pullRequest.title: Add timeout handler in JsonRpcHttpService.
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR description
Scope of logs query causing Besu to crash.
eth_getLogs queries that are too large or too broad can cause Besu to crash. Options to prevent this from occurring include:

Stop the logs query by detecting DB close exceptions or another signal
Adding a time limit to the query and recommending they reduce the scope if the time limit is reached.

This PR focuses on the time limit. It enables to configure a different timeout per RPC method.
The timeout handler is added to both JSON RPC and GraphQL services. Both rely on VertX handlers utilities.
Changes summary

Created TimeoutOptions class with fields:

timeout: the timeout in milliseconds.
errorCode: the http status code.


Created TimeoutHandler.

Contains handler static method to create Vertx Handler. The process of the handler created is the following

retrieve the body as string.
parse it as a JsonObject.
cache the resulting JsonObject in the RoutingContext.
retrieve the RPC method name.
set a timer based on the configuration if the method name matches one entry in the configuration map.
call the next handler.




Added --Xhttp-timeout CLI options.

Fixed Issue(s)
fixes #944
Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net
Potential follow up pull requests

Add the possibility to configure the per request timeout through CLI.
Add a global timeout applied for all requests.
Add the possibility to configure the global timeout through CLI.

commit.message:
Add timeout handler in JsonRpcHttpService.

- Created `TimeoutOptions` class with fields:
    - *timeout*: the timeout in milliseconds.
    - *errorCode*: the http status code.
- Created `EthRpcTimeoutHandler`.
    -  Contains `handler` static method to create `Vertx Handler`. The process of the handler created is the following
        - retrieve the body as string.
        - parse it as a `JsonObject`.
        - cache the resulting `JsonObject` in the `RoutingContext`.
        - retrieve the RPC method name.
        - set a timer based on the configuration if the method name matches one entry in the configuration map.
        - call the next handler.

Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta <abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net>

Fixed unit test

nodes.bodyText: Should this be moved to a method to make the lambda simpler?
Don't we have a more elegant way to verify that it's a json? or do we think this is sufficient in this context?
Late to the party as this is already committed, but is 2 days really the default timeout?  I was thinking more like 2-5 minutes.
